title: Game-Based Exploration of Mathematical Abstraction: Symmetry Design and Strategic Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: For current professionals requiring mathematical abstraction for scientific problem-solving in practice. Develops abstract thinking skills in non-traditional contexts via game-based environments

learning_goals: Learners will autonomously design three or more tools (e.g., Unity Mirror, Blender Symmetry Modifier) and two or more strategies (e.g., reflection algorithms, grid-based placement) to maintain symmetry in virtual environment construction, achieving over 80% suitability scores in peer and expert reviews.

Learners will perform three or more game-based tasks (e.g., simulation games, puzzle games), derive two or more abstraction models linking everyday and scientific knowledge, and achieve over 80% suitability in peer evaluations and expert feedback.

Learners will present a final problem-solving strategy reflecting at least two key improvements over the initial plan after three feedback cycles (problem-solving strategy development → expert feedback → revision) over six months.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
